body:
`rake app:foobar:install:migrations` is broken, so this should be removed or fixed

#### Lets explain my special use case:

I've created a custom template for creating a engine..
So lets say I'm doing :
`rails plugin new foo --mountable --skip-bundle --template=<template_path>`
Foo depends on engine "bar". (`gem "bar"` within template)

So the generator of foo should copy migrations from bar:

    rake app:bar:install:migrations
    rake db:migrate # unsure if this works

So, any `rake app:<engine>:install:migrations` is broken.
Yeah, you could just `cd test/dummy` and run the task, but I'd like
to invoke these rake tasks within my engine template.

Her is a snippet of the template:

    # HACK: cause "app:bar:install:migrations"  fails with current Rails (3.2.3)
    inside(dummy_path) do
      `bundle exec bar:install:migrations`
    end

    inside(destination_root) do
      #rake("app:bar:install:migrations") # Fails with Rails 3.2.3
      rake("db:create")
      rake("db:migrate")
      rake("app:#{name}:install")
    end

As you see, I've to hack around to get it working.
